projects.role: Frontend Engineer at Naver Financial (Oct 2024 - Present)

project1.title: Naver Financial - Employee Welfare Platform (Frontend Lead)

descriptions.0: Led frontend architecture design and implementation using React Router Data APIs for a scalable Single Page Application.
descriptions.1: Designed a custom error handling framework between BFF and frontend, enabling contextual, modal, and page-level error recovery aligned with UX requirements.
descriptions.2: Improved application performance through lazy loading, request deduplication, and optimized React compiler usage.
descriptions.3: Developed complex validation workflows with React Hook Form and Zod, including file signature verification for secure uploads.
descriptions.4: Enhanced production observability and security with Sentry integration and hidden sourcemaps via Vite build pipelines.
descriptions.5: Automated API type generation with Swagger TypeScript API, improving developer productivity and backend integration consistency.
descriptions.6: Reduced production bundle size by 30% through dynamic imports, excluding mock and development-only modules.
descriptions.7: Introduced Canary dark-release deployment strategy for safer QA and progressive rollouts, replacing legacy Blue/Green approach.

project2.title: Naver Financial - Customer Inquiry Portal (Frontend Development, Sub Project)

descriptions.0: Built the customer inquiry page and customized the Ant Design DatePicker component to meet business requirements.
descriptions.1: Conducted cross-device testing using Android Studio and Xcode to resolve layout, scroll, and event bubbling issues.

project3.title: Naver Financial - Internal Admin Dashboard (Frontend Development, Sub Project)

descriptions.0: Contributed to two internal admin dashboards using React and Jotai for state management.
descriptions.1: Integrated multiple backend and BFF APIs to ensure seamless synchronization and data consistency.

descriptions.0: Built a full-stack personal blog using Next.js (^15 App Router) and Supabase for authentication, storage, and database management.
descriptions.1: Leveraged Next.js Server Actions to handle user authentication and post creation securely without exposing client-side API routes.
descriptions.2: Implemented a custom Markdown editor and renderer (MDX-based) to support rich content authoring.
descriptions.3: Designed and developed a minimal design system using Tailwind CSS for consistent typography, spacing, and component styles.
descriptions.4: Utilized Next.js Middleware to handle protected routes and enforce authentication on server side.
descriptions.5:
Enhanced login security by integrating CAPTCHA to block automated bot attacks and implementing Redis-backed IP rate limiting to
              mitigate brute-force attempts.
